alert.note: Alert for Lawrence; Lewis (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 22 at 5:18PM CST until further notice by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Middle Tennessee, including the following counties, Bedford, Giles, Lawrence, Lewis, Marshall, Maury, Rutherford and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 715 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 518 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen already today and storms and heavy showers in the area will significantly increased the flooding risk. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Murfreesboro, Columbia, Shelbyville, Lewisburg, Lawrenceburg, Pulaski, Waynesboro, Mount Pleasant, Loretto, Collinwood, Summertown, Clifton, Chapel Hill, Cornersville, St. Joseph, Eagleville, Ethridge, Lynnville, Henryville and Culleoka. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
